name: Melia Bali Indonesia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Melia this past March. Everything you would expect from a 5 Star resort, except I must point out now that although I've stayed in a good many resorts in my time, I have never received such genuinely warm and gracious service in my life. It was amazing, we were blown away. Perhaps it's just the Bali way. Yes it was humid but ,you are afterall just south of the equator, and if you follow the hotel guidelines and keep your balcony door closed, no problem, very comfortable. Yes it is pricey for the bars and restaurants, but the hotel offered a very good deal for a discount on drinks and meals purchased in the hotel. The best bet to save a bit is to go to the new shopping centre ( the name escapes me), about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, although there is a free shuttle. There's great shopping and about 8 restaurants, quite a variety, and about half the price or less than eating at the hotel. Most of the restaurants allow you to sign the bill to your hotel account. It's true as others have said the breakfast really was not up to 5 star standard but it was really good nevertheless.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By all means, take a spa treatment at the Yhi Spa, on the grounds. We had a couples massage, 2 persons, 1 1/2 hours, $90.00 U.S. A great deal and it felt wonderful. The masseusses are really good. All decent and above board.
reviews.title: steer clear unless rich
Another reat Stay In Bali
reviews.text: Finally, we will return there one day, only this time it will be a longer stay. It was pure pleasure.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel looks lovely as did the rooms. But it is true about the damp. It stank and the bed was damp most nights. Asked nearly every day to change rooms but was told there were none available! - so lived with it! Bathrooms and house keeping excellent. Prices were exhorbitant - they had you over a barrel as there was nowhere else to buy snacks/drinks during the day (unless you want to walk for 15 mins) . Recommend eat out at night - you can get a taxi but the walk is nice and you dont get too bothered by people trying to get you in the taxi - just say no thanks. The balinese were wonderful people (and genuine). Dont recommend the massage! My partner had parts massaged that shouldnt have been (if you know what I mean) and was in quite a lot of pain. He wouldnt complain as he was too embarrassed. Very weird - maybe they were having a laugh with him?? No pubs/clubs/bars that we could find in Nusa Dua - so whilst a very nice place, not a lot to do in the evening.
reviews.title: Ideal place for Ideal holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Hotel freindly staff good food ( drinks can be expensive) stayed for 2 weeks with friends ( their first time in Bali) Booked the Duplex suites - smellt damp Firends changed their rooms ( smellt worse than ours) I think it's because people left the balcony doors open. Rooms comfy, beach massage a lot cheaper than the spa ( but you get what you pay for Left leg got a lot more treatement than the rest of me) Good food ( excellent in the mediterranean restaurant). Bar staff friendly but a bit aloof / shy. Nice walks into the local village for meals etc. Overasll good fun place on the beach
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful & so friendly

likes.disliked: — the expense of the food & drink in the hotel

reviews.text: Our stay at the Melia Bali from 24 Aug 07 for 7 nights was wonderful. The hotel is set in the deluxe 5 star resort of Nusa Dua in the South of the Island. The resort is a lush tropical paradise and the gardens, walkways, ponds and surroundings are just beautiful. The hotel has a marvellous pool which never felt crowded - even though the hotel was full. It had many bars and restaurants one of which was right on the beach.
reviews.title: the Melia Bali - heaven on earth!

likes.liked: — the luxury, great facilities, friendly service and location
likes.disliked: — nothing really although a small quibble would be the hotels price for food, but hey, all hotels charge top whack!

reviews.title: Friendly but dampness and porr reception staff let it down.
reviews.text: We ate breakfast on several days in the hotel. They offer an 'a la carte'; continental or American style buffet. We opted for the latter and the choice was incredible. There is an outside 'omelette station' where you can have eggs cooked anyway you like and they will make you pancakes too.

The beach was lovely and a short stroll from any of the rooms. The water is very calm and there are no large waves as such. The tide goes out quite far and you can walk a way out - remember your flip-flops or other beach shoes as there is coral and stones out there. You can book your watersports from the beacjfront and they will collect you - on offer was all sorts - parascending; snorkelling; scuba, banana rafts, glass bottom sight-seeting boards, jet-ski-ing and more!
reviews.title: Will never find a better resort anywhere in the world!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were allocated a Duplex room in the Royal Suite - the double bed was on a mezannine level. On the ground floor there was a single day-bed, table and chairs, tv, mini-bar and seperate toilet with sink. The balcony was accessed by large double doors and was quite large with a table/chair and chaise bed.
reviews.title: Melia bali - Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read before about the musty smell of the rooms. We did notice this, but to be honest, it was not offensive. The island is lush and humid and so it is only to be expected.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia Bali from the 21st December to 27 th December 2006. This was Stunning, the room was big very nice decorated. The bathroom big. The Hotel staff is very friendly. The only fault we could find with the hotel was that the breakfast was definately not up to 5* standard. Overhaul the stay was pleasant and I could recommend this hotel.

I got married at Melia Bali in September 2006 and stayed at the hotel for 3 weeks in total. The wedding's at this hotel are out of this world and the wedding co-ordinator Made is the friendliest most helpful lady you will ever meet. Nothing was to much trouble and we got married at the Balinese wedding house on the beach front which was stunning. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to get married in Bali - you just won't believe all the effort that is put in to make your day special. Not like the conveyor belt style weddings in the caribbean.
reviews.title: Weddings @ Melia

likes.liked: — Stunning hotel and location. Friendly staff.

reviews.title: melia bali
reviews.text: The hotel itself is gorgeous and we stayed in a split level superior room and the garden villa on our wedding night. I just can't praise this hotel enough. If you need any more info just get in touch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the melia bali for two weeks from the 26th nov to 10th dec what a fantastic place , we has a royal suite room and i could not fault it at all , it was clean and damp free. the hotels gardens are fantastic and the pool is great to, there are plenty of sun beds and it has the sun all day long , the hotel was expensive for food and drinks but if you get a taxi out side the front gates ( not inside as they are also expensive ) and go to the village eigther laguna gargen side where we spent most of our time as its great food and very entertaning staff, or bali bistro side which is also very good as is the tropical very cheap and really clean .its a fab place and i will be returning next year .
reviews.title: 5 Star Bali

likes.disliked: — Wine prices and the initial dampness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Melia for three weeks, the hotel is in a gated compound shared by 6 or so other hotels of similair standard. As the Melia had a very good deal (two weeks for one) it was the only one anywhere near half full ( no australians returning yet). Resteraunt facilities and bar facilities were excellent although you do pay for it compared to outside the hotel but service and quality were superb. the grounds and and all buildings were immaculate and very atractive. Our room was a perfect size , nice balcony overlooking the gardens, very nice indeed.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but there is room for improvement
My second home
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Melia Hotel twice a year for the last 6 years, wny do I keep going back, well it is onew of the friendliest places I have stayed throughout my World travels. The staff from the GM down to the gardeners are remarkable and genuine, a smile and a greeting whoever you are. The Hotel itself is warm and welcoming, the grounds are amazing and there is plenty to do without having to leave the resort.The personal touches offered really make you feel like part of the 'melia' family and not just 'another tourist'This is my heaven on earth and I am proud to say I have many friends there. All the resturants there offer a wide variety of very good food, and yes you do pay just that little bit extra but then it is classed as five star, and in reflection to other 5 star hotels I have stayed in this is by far the most value for money and the most relaxing. Nusa Dua is said not to be the real Bali and to some extent I agree, but nothing is too far away and transport is plenty cheap enough to see the island from there. The village of Bualu offers cheap resturants with free transport and the newly opened Bali collection offers plenty of shopping. Melia Bali to me is the most relaxing place and the only one I want to be at to replenish my soul and re-new my lust for life.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights before heading across the island and it was magnificent! We booked a royal service suite which was a bit pricier than a regular room, but gave us access to a private lounge (with free cocktails), private pool, and a private beach area. However, the regular facilities were fantastic as well. It was ideal for anyone that wants quality time with someone special. That being said, remember that Nusa Dua itself is very secluded and totally separated from the "normal" daily activity of Bali. If you want to be around the buzz, then you'd be better off staying in Kuta or Seminyak. Nusa Dua is meant for traveler isolation.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was prompt and friendly. People were available for anything that you might need. The morning buffet is extensive and quite good, but somewhat pricey. Try to get it included in the price of your stay because you won't have any other options for food in the morning, unless you want to drive into another town.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the reviewers had remarked about a slight odor in the rooms. I noted this before I booked and did experience this while at the hotel, but that is not the whole story. First, the odor is very slight. It is caused by condensation in the air conditioning units. Second, nearly all hotels with aircon that are near the equator will have this same problem.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this was one of the most pleasant stays I've had in all my travels.
reviews.title: Love it all

likes.liked: — beach, spa and pool. but main reason, location, Nusa Dua.
likes.disliked: — Potential slippery zones at lobby poor staircase indicators at lobby and lobby lounge

aka: Melia Bali Indonesia Hotel Nusa Dua
description: The luxurious hotel is located in a tropical garden, right on Nusa Dua beach. Close to a magnificent golf course and the Nusa Dua shopping & leisure district. Nearby point of interest are the capital, Denpasar, 35 km distance from the hotel, and Kuta, just 10 km away. The International Airport is 20 min. away.
